senses.ex: I forgot where I placed my keys.

Tips.title: Temporary Forgetfulness
Tips.description: Used to express that something slipped one's mind temporarily but can be remembered later.
Tips.example: I forgot her name, but then it came back to me.

Tips.title: Intentional Reminder
Tips.description: Often used in a polite request to remind someone of something they might have forgotten.
Tips.example: Don't forget to call me when you arrive.

Tips.title: Emotional Impact
Tips.description: Forgetting something important can imply carelessness and hurt feelings.
Tips.example: He forgot our anniversary, and I was really upset.

senses.de: not to consider or pay attention to
senses.ex: We should not forget the sacrifices of our ancestors.

Tips.title: Conscious Ignoring
Tips.description: Sometimes it means choosing not to think about something on purpose.
Tips.example: Forget the haters; just do your best.

Tips.title: Momentary Inattention
Tips.description: Can be used when someone momentarily fails to pay attention or consider something.
Tips.example: Sorry, I forgot you were vegetarian when I ordered the pizza.

senses.de: not to mention or include someone or something by accident
senses.ex: She forgot to add sugar in the cake.

Tips.title: Accidental Exclusion
Tips.description: Indicates unintentionally leaving someone or something out.
Tips.example: I forgot to invite Lucy to the meeting; I'll call her now.

Tips.title: Task-Related Slip
Tips.description: Often used when a detail is missed in the process of doing something.
Tips.example: I forgot to attach the file, sending it again.

senses.de: to stop thinking about someone or something
senses.ex: It's hard for me to forget him even after so many years.
cl: put it out of your mind

Tips.title: Moving On
Tips.description: Used to talk about letting go of past events or people.
Tips.example: I know it's tough, but you need to forget her and move on.

Tips.title: Intentional Avoidance
Tips.description: Can imply choosing not to dwell on something unpleasant or unworthy.
Tips.example: Forget those bad reviews; focus on the positive feedback.

Disregard.wordDefinition: Disregard means to not pay attention to something or to intentionally ignore it. It is applicable when someone intentionally chooses to ignore or avoid a certain thing.

Fail.wordDefinition:
Fail means to be unsuccessful in achieving a goal, and it is applicable when you have tried to do something but could not succeed.

For example, if you fail a test, it means that you did not get the required marks.

Fail is used when you do not succeed in achieving a goal, and forget is used when you do not remember something.

Ignore.wordDefinition:
Ignore means to actively choose not to pay attention to someone or something, often intentionally disregarding something.

For example, if someone is being mean to you in school and you choose to ignore them, you are making a conscious decision not to engage with them.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Forgetting is usually unintentional and can happen to anyone. Ignoring is a deliberate action and can be used as a coping mechanism or a way to show disapproval or lack of interest.

Miss.wordDefinition:
Miss means that you feel sad or upset because someone or something is not present. For example, if you miss your friend, you are sad because they are not with you, even though you remember them and their importance to you.

Forget is related to memory and miss is related to feelings of loss or absence. Each one is applicable in different situations based on the context of the event.

Neglect.wordDefinition:
Neglect means to fail to take care of something or someone properly. For example, if you neglect your plants by not watering them and giving them sunlight, they will die.

Forget is related to memory or unintentionally leaving something behind while neglect relates to not taking proper care of something or someone on purpose.

Omit.wordDefinition:
Forget means to fail to remember something or someone that one ought to remember, while Omit means to leave out or exclude something or someone.

If you omit a book from a list of required reading, it means that you have left that book out of the list intentionally.

Forget refers more to a lapse of memory while omit refers to a deliberate action of leaving something out.

Overlook.wordDefinition:
Forget means to fail to remember something or someone, while overlook means to miss seeing or noticing something.

However, if you overlook a typo in a report, it means you missed it by mistake.

Forget is applicable when you didn't recall something at all, while overlook is applicable when you missed something by chance.

Slip.wordDefinition:
Slip means to make an error or mistake or to lose one's balance or footing. It's applicable when you make a small mistake or accidentally say something incorrectly.

For example, you might slip and call your teacher "mom" by mistake.

This consolidation occurs with the help of a major part of the brain, known as the hippocampus.

quotes.Text: The war made me stronger; it was a very hard time for me and my family. I don't want to drag that with me forever, but I don't want to forget about it, either.
quotes.Title: Croatian Athlete
quotes.Name: Luka Modric

quotes.Text: All my life, whenever it comes time to make a decision, I make it and forget about it.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Harry S Truman

quotes.Text: How happy is the blameless vestal's lot? The world forgetting, by the world forgot.
quotes.Title: English Poet
quotes.Name: Alexander Pope

quotes.Text: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
quotes.Title: Albanian Saint
quotes.Name: Mother Teresa

quotes.Text: I think it's important as an artist to never forget where you're from.
quotes.Title: Puerto Rican Singer
quotes.Name: Bad Bunny

quotes.Text: My part of the world - it's like time forgot it almost.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Brady Jandreau

quotes.Text: Friendships are forgotten when the game begins.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Alvin Dark

quotes.Text: My biggest fear in life is to be forgotten.
quotes.Title: Argentinian Statesman
quotes.Name: Evita Peron

quotes.Text: Live your life and forget your age.
quotes.Title: German Author
quotes.Name: Jean Paul

quotes.Text: Life is good - we forget that.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Maryam D'Abo
